item.title: Beirut Explosion Caused by Fire Kills Dozens, Injures Thousands
item.description: Dozens of people were confirmed dead and thousands more injured after a massive explosion caused by a warehouse fire rocked Lebanon’s capital city of Beirut.

item.title: Foreign Powers Face Off in Libyan Civil War, Risking Wider Conflict
item.description: International forces facing off across the Libyan conflict’s new front line on the approaches to its oil-rich east threaten to transform the struggle into a wider, regional fight, fueled by economic interests and geopolitical rivalry.

item.title: India Marks a Historic Win for Hindu Nationalists
item.description: India’s ascendant Hindu nationalist movement will notch a historic victory when Prime Minister Narendra Modi lays a ceremonial cornerstone on Wednesday to begin construction of a bitterly contested Hindu temple in Ayodhya.

item.title: Trump Call for Cut of TikTok Deal Reignites Anger in China
item.description: President Trump’s suggestion that the U.S. government take a cut from the forced sale of the viral Chinese app TikTok sparked a new round of anger and reflection in China, as TikTok’s founder warned employees about “rising anti-Chinese sentiment.”

item.title: Argentina Agrees to $65 Billion Restructuring Deal With Bondholders
item.description: Argentina confirmed on Tuesday that it reached an agreement with its major foreign private creditors, a step that the economy ministry said will “grant the country significant debt relief” and resolve its third sovereign default in two decades.

item.title: Flight of Former King Raises Pressure to Reform Spain's Monarchy
item.description: King Juan Carlos I had been lauded for helping to steer Spain toward democracy, but financial scandals tarnished his legacy and jeopardized Spain’s royal family.
